gov.usgs.locator

Class InitialID

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.InitialID

  • public class InitialID
extends java.lang.Object
    Before any location iteration or real phase identification takes place, this initial pass ensures that we have something reasonable to work with by emphasizing crust and mantle P waves and manually identified phases. If there are a lot of apparently misidentified first arrivals, the algorithm gets even more draconian.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void printInitialID()
      List the phases used in the initial relocation.
      void resetUseFlags()
      After refining the starting location based on the initial phase identification and doing a more rigorous phase identification, we can put some of phases that were temporarily taken out of the location back in.
      void survey()
      Do a tentative phase identification to see if the event is making sense.

    • Method Detail

      • survey

        public void survey()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Do a tentative phase identification to see if the event is making sense.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - On an illegal source depth

      • resetUseFlags

        public void resetUseFlags()
        After refining the starting location based on the initial phase identification and doing a more rigorous phase identification, we can put some of phases that were temporarily taken out of the location back in.

      • printInitialID

        public void printInitialID()
        List the phases used in the initial relocation. Note that they may have been re-identified after the initialID algorithm.
